steps.text: Cover the pork chop with cornstarch and remove any extra powder that is on it
Rub salt into 1 side of the pork chop. Make sure the salt is spread completely on the surface of the pork chop

Cut the pork chop in half. It would be great to separate the pork chop into groups that have bone and no bone attached to it. When frying the pork chop, the amount of time needed is the same as cooking the two groups separately.
Fry (both sides) pork chops and take them out
Wash the wok and add a little bit of oil to the wok. The pork chop has oil on it so not a lot of oil is needed else the result will be too greasy
Put the pork chops back into the wok
Pour the sauce onto the pork chop and pour half a bowl of hot water from the side of the work.
Stir the pork chop so the sauce can completely spread to all the pork chops.
Put the lid on the wok and wait 2 min.
Open the lid, turn the flame back to high add a little bit of vinegar to the porkchop.
Take out the porkchop and leave the sauce in the wok
Add the green onion to the wok and let it cook for 15 seconds
Pour the sauce onto the porkchop
